translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Timira
“Having entered Pokkharavana,🔽I was plucking lotus flowers here;
There I saw the Buddha Phussa,
I raised it up in the sky;
Having given up bad conduct by speech,
I do not remember any bad destination,

analyzed: buddha pūjāyidam  paduma ābhāsa nāmā ca
translated: This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In eighteen eons,🔽They attained eighty-four thousand.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā padumapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā padumapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus did the venerable Paduma Flower Elder chant these verses.
Paduma Flower Elder’s Birth Story is the tenth.
Two with the idea of a plough, the fruit-giver,
the one with the idea of sound, the sprinkler;
